basics.name: Duc Q. Nguyen
basics.label: PhD Student in Computer Science
basics.summary: My foremost goal is to amplify human potential through artificial intelligence. My research interests lie in human-AI alignment, with a particular focus on generative models and probabilistic methods. I aim to develop methods that can collaborate effectively with humans to enhance their capabilities in critical domains such as healthcare and education.

work.name: Ho Chi Minh City University of Technology (HCMUT) - Vietnam National University HCMC
work.summary: Developed Vietnamese Large Language Models (URA-LLaMa, MixSUra, GemSUra). Conducted research on graph neural networks for drug discovery and subgraph matching. Worked on neural machine translation for low-resource languages (Bahnaric).

work.name: Stanford University
work.summary: Working on generative models and probabilistic machine learning at STAIR Lab, advised by Prof. Sanmi Koyejo and mentored by Sang T. Truong.

work.name: URA Lab, HCMUT
work.summary: Developed Vietnamese Large Language Models (URA-LLaMa, MixSUra, GemSUra). Conducted research on graph neural networks for drug discovery and subgraph matching. Worked on neural machine translation for low-resource languages (Bahnaric).

education.institution: Ho Chi Minh City University of Technology (HCMUT), VNU-HCM

publications.name: Neural Nonmyopic Bayesian Optimization in Dynamic Cost Settings
publications.publisher: ICLR 2025 Workshop: Towards Agentic AI for Science: Hypothesis Generation, Comprehension, Quantification, and Validation
publications.summary: Research on advanced Bayesian optimization methods for dynamic cost settings.

publications.name: Explainable Neural Subgraph Matching With Learnable Multi-Hop Attention
publications.summary: Novel approach to explainable neural subgraph matching using learnable multi-hop attention mechanisms.

publications.name: Crossing Linguistic Horizons: Finetuning and Evaluation of Vietnamese Large Language Models
publications.summary: Comprehensive study on finetuning and evaluation of Vietnamese Large Language Models.

publications.name: Towards De Novo Drug Design for the Coronavirus: A Drug-Target Interaction Prediction Approach using Atom-enhanced Graph Neural Network with Multi-hop Gating Mechanism
publications.summary: Award-winning research on drug-target interaction prediction for coronavirus drug design.

publications.name: BeCaked: An Explainable Artificial Intelligence Model for COVID-19 Forecasting
publications.summary: Explainable AI model for COVID-19 case forecasting with interpretable predictions.

projects.name: Probabilistic Pedagogy for Accelerated Learning
projects.summary: Developed a computational framework for simulating interactive teaching scenarios between a teacher and a student. The framework models both rational and naive students and supports multiple teaching and learning strategies to study effective pedagogical approaches.

projects.name: Automatically Evolving Multi-agent Deep Research System
projects.summary: Developed an autonomous, evolving multi-agent system for deep research pipelines. The system generates research questions, conducts literature-style analysis, evaluates reports, and continuously improves itself through iterative feedback and fine-tuning.

projects.name: Vietnamese Large Language Models
projects.summary: Developed URA-LLaMa, MixSUra, and GemSUra - a family of Vietnamese Large Language Models with 7B, 13B, and 70B parameters.

projects.name: Neural Subgraph Matching
projects.summary: Research on explainable and efficient neural subgraph matching methods with applications in drug discovery.

projects.name: BeCaked - COVID-19 Forecasting
projects.summary: Developed an explainable AI model for COVID-19 case forecasting, published in Scientific Reports.
